confession.seduction_context: Father took her to sabbat at la Bouze between Mandray and Entre-deux-Eaux; 2-3 days later Percin approached and asked her to renounce God. Refused at first but agreed when father insisted.
powder_types: powder made by father in a pot
sabbat_locations: la Bouze between Mandray and Entre-deux-Eaux

witnesses.name: Colas Henry Finance
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Previously testified against her; she visited his house before

testimony.quarrel_subject: He struck one of her sons 4-5 years earlier

witnesses.name: Marie veuve Demenge Jacquemin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Widow of deceased husband who was doyen to maire

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 years earlier; died in 5 days after drinking at accused's house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Around Easter he questioned why she invited people her husband had disputes with to drink
testimony.threat_quote: elle feroit des choses que l'on parleroit d'elle

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: a week later; recovered after long time

testimony.threat_quote: qu'a cest fois auroit elle ses joyes et scauroit la verité de la mort de son mary

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 years before next winter; died after 3 months illness

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute with husband over tax they were levying together 3 years ago last May

witnesses.name: Claude Colas Woinier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Knew her when she lived with father

testimony.quarrel_subject: He called her a witch 16-18 years earlier when she boasted supernatural powers
He outbid them for a house next to their own 2 years earlier
Dispute with husband on eve of last St Jean
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il leur en vouloit mais qu'il n'en gaignieroit guiere et s'en repentiroit

testimony.quarrel_subject: 4 years before he leased 4 bullocks; she told him he was very avaricious and would make little profit

harms_alleged.target: Barbelline (his sister, mother of accused's husband)

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Previously tried, presented to the question, and renvoyée (released)

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Confronted with Jean Blaise Laisney who maintained accusation of seeing her at sabbat; also confronted with Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; denied charges and made counter-accusations of theft

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Procureur for canons asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Withstood thumbscrews but confessed when racked; extensive confession of sabbat attendance and malefices

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Continued confession; implicated her son Jean in witchcraft

timeline.subject: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Jean Blaise Laisney
accomplices_named.context: Saw her at sabbat; also identified as one of two principal masters who went up in clouds to direct hail

accomplices_named.name: Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean de Saulcy
accomplices_named.context: Maintained charges against accused in confrontation

accomplices_named.name: Jacques Gabourel
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; told her to go to sabbat with him 3 months after father's arrest; she suspected him of killing Claude Colnot

accomplices_named.name: Barbelline femme Mengeon Jean
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; arrested with accused in 1589

accomplices_named.name: Colatte femme Vincent Jean Laisné
accomplices_named.context: Instigated killing of Jacques Valentin Finance; helped by placing herself in front of candle; put powder between lips and blew it into his mouth

accomplices_named.name: Jean (son of accused)
accomplices_named.context: Accused's eldest son; taken to sabbat 18 months earlier, persuaded to renounce God, attended sabbat 4-5 times, given powder by mother and Percin to kill animals

prior_accusations.context: Accused knew she had been accused by two convicted witches before 1596 trial

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin (attributed to father Jean Babey)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle yroit bien a l'eglise de plein jour sans estre apperceue de personne, et que en aultant de temps que le prebtre pourroit mettre a chanter la messe elle feroit bien ruyner l'eglise dudit Mandray et en oster les pierres l'une l'apres l'autre
notable_quotes.english: that she would go to the church in broad daylight without being noticed by anyone, and that in as much time as the priest could take to sing mass she would indeed ruin the church of Mandray and remove the stones one after the other
notable_quotes.context: Boastful statement heard by witness 16-18 years earlier when she lived with her father

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
notable_quotes.french: elle feroit des choses que l'on parleroit d'elle
notable_quotes.english: she would do things that people would talk about her
notable_quotes.context: Threat to witness about people coming to drink at her house despite disputes

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
notable_quotes.french: qu'a cest fois auroit elle ses joyes et scauroit la verité de la mort de son mary
notable_quotes.english: that this time she would have her joys and would know the truth about her husband's death
notable_quotes.context: Said angrily to widow of Jacques Valentin Finance when returning from flight

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline (mother-in-law)
notable_quotes.french: nourre et caigne et qu'elle luy avoit ensorcellé et luy donné la mort
notable_quotes.english: nurse and bitch and that she had bewitched her and given her death

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
notable_quotes.french: et est ledit son marit de sy bonne sorte qu'elle luy eust bien faict croire que l'eaue alloit a contremont
notable_quotes.english: and her husband is of such good nature that she could have made him believe that water goes uphill
notable_quotes.context: Explaining how husband didn't know about sabbat attendance

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Demenge Claude Martin
notable_quotes.french: qu'une personne qui s'est bien signé et recommandé a dieu le matin Il est bien asseuré que le diable ny sorciers ne luy pourront nuire quant a son corps mais qu'indifferement avec leur pouldre et poison elles peuvent faire mourir et malade le bestail de quelque personne qu'elles auroient envie de luy mal faire
notable_quotes.english: that a person who has made the sign of the cross well and commended themselves to God in the morning is well assured that the devil nor witches can harm them as to their body, but that indifferently with their powder and poison they can cause death and sickness to the livestock of any person they would want to harm
notable_quotes.context: Explaining limitations of witchcraft against protected Christians

relationships.evidence_text: married to Demenge Claude Martin some 18 years
fille bastarde of late Jean Babey, executed as a witch
she had ceased to frequent his house as she had previously done
her late husband was doyen to maire Demenge Martin Girard

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost a mare and a foal
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He struck one of her sons

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died in 5 days after saying he was sure he had taken his death at her house
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: People feared to drink at maire's house because they feared his wife

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill and died after drinking at her house
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness questioned why she invited people her husband had disputes with

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill but recovered after long time
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Drank at her house when others feared to

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died after 3 months of unknown illness; felt bad-smelling breath enter his body
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: None mentioned; at spinning gathering
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Blowing on his face with bad-smelling breath (later confessed: powder between lips blown into mouth)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Grain scattered by whirlwind while surrounding land unaffected
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with husband over tax they were levying together
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: at harvest time (several months after quarrel in May)

harms_catalog.harm_description: 2 cows, 2 bullocks, 6 calves, and 7 sheep died, most suddenly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with husband over tax

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow became swollen after drinking and died in 2 hours in strange manner
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He outbid them for a house next to their own

harms_catalog.harm_description: Mare died after being beaten when it strayed into their field
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Mare strayed into their field and was beaten

harms_catalog.harm_description: Foal sickened and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute with husband on eve of St Jean

harms_catalog.harm_description: 3 of 4 leased bullocks died in strangest fashion
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She said he was very avaricious and would make little profit

harms_catalog.harm_description: 22 cattle died within a year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Unknown initially; suspected after her remarks

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness; called accused 'nurse and bitch' and said she had bewitched her and given her death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused was angry at false accusation of causing illness
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Devil (Percin) gave her fatal illness at accused's request

harms_catalog.harm_description: Poisoned pear intended to bewitch witness; tested on sow which died with piglets
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jealousy over husband's friendship with accused

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow killed with powder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Cow damaged their field

harms_catalog.harm_description: Goat killed with powder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She had stolen their grain

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sick cow killed so she wouldn't have to stay up tending it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband wanted her to stay up and tend sick cow

harms_catalog.harm_description: Calf killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He called her witch 'en cachette'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Pig killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He said her father had been dragged on 'une claie' and his daughter would be too

harms_catalog.harm_description: 2 geese killed by her son Jean with powder she gave him
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Geese went in her meadow

harms_catalog.harm_description: Goat killed by her son Jean with powder from Percin
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jean had fight with son of Catellon Colin

harms_catalog.harm_description: Naxon killed by her son Jean with powder from Percin
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She and husband had quarrel and fight with Jacques

harms_catalog.harm_description: Reyllon killed by her son Jean
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Fight with son of Demenge Claude Menginot

harms_catalog.harm_description: Naxon became strangely ill but did not die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jean fought with son of Vincent

harms_catalog.harm_description: Claude fell strangely ill and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jacques wanted accused to kill Claude or his son but she refused

material_culture.context: Animals lost by witness after quarrel
Water vessel in kitchen where poisoned water was kept
Given by accused to witness's husband; became black and full of grease; killed sow and piglets when fed to them
Accused claimed witness had stolen these
Accused claimed witness had stolen these
Accused claimed witness had stolen this
Made by father in pot kept for this purpose; given by devil; used for malefices
Kept by father for making magical powder
Colatte Vincent placed herself in front of candle so accused could breathe on victim more easily
Father had been dragged on this (execution method)

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused and most witnesses
Place between Mandray and Entre-deux-Eaux where sabbats were held
Neighboring village; la Bouze was between Mandray and this village
Location of Claudatte veuve Estienne Jean who maintained charges
Where accused fled to relatives for advice
Where husband brought accused to be made prisoner
Where girls and young women were spinning; where dancing occurred and accused approached victim
Church she allegedly boasted about being able to ruin
Where people were supposed to drink after deals but feared to because of accused

weather_events: hail made at sabbat (though not much damage)
economic_hardship_indicators: debt of 100 francs from bullock deaths

hearsay_chains.content: Heard Jacques Valentin Finance maintain to death that she had poisoned him
Told story of illness and death of Demenge Jacquemin
Husband said she had poisoned him with bad breath

emotional_state_notes: fled when she saw armed men coming to arrest her
said angrily to witness when returning from flight

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: He was a coiner, and his wife's daughter was his wife every 3 weeks
Had stolen a loaf and some turnips
Had stolen 5 hams and a chicken
Said to have stolen some fish

third_parties.name: Jean Babey
third_parties.context: Father of accused; executed as witch; took her to sabbat; made magical powder; allegedly boasted of supernatural powers

third_parties.name: Demenge Claude Martin
third_parties.context: Married to accused for 18 years; brought her to St Dié to be imprisoned; described as very trusting

third_parties.name: Jean (son of accused)
third_parties.context: Struck by witness 1; taken to sabbat by mother 18 months earlier; renounced God; given powder to kill animals; implicated in multiple malefices

third_parties.name: Demenge Martin Girard
third_parties.context: Maire; husband of accused feared; people wouldn't drink at his house after deals

third_parties.name: Claude Jean Didier Cunin (old maire)
third_parties.context: Old maire; he and his son had many disputes and lawsuits with accused's husband; would not drink at her house out of fear

third_parties.name: Claude (son of old maire)
third_parties.context: Son of old maire; would not drink at accused's house out of fear

third_parties.name: Didier Grand Colin of Entre-deux-Eaux
third_parties.context: Drank at accused's house; became ill but recovered after long time

third_parties.name: Colatte Vincent
third_parties.context: Helped accused kill Jacques Valentin Finance by placing herself in front of candle

third_parties.name: Barbelline
third_parties.context: Mother of accused's husband; died of strange illness; accused her on deathbed of bewitching her

third_parties.name: Henry le Tisserant
third_parties.context: Accused fled to his house when she saw armed men coming to arrest her

third_parties.name: Jean Didier Rabat
third_parties.context: His cow damaged accused's field; she killed it with powder after marriage

third_parties.name: Cunin's Mathiatte's wife
third_parties.context: Accused killed her goat because she had stolen their grain

third_parties.name: Claude Colnot
third_parties.context: Jacques Gabourel wanted accused to kill him; he fell strangely ill and died; accused thought it was Jacques's doing

third_parties.name: Gregoire Gabourel
third_parties.context: His geese went in accused's meadow; her son killed 2 with powder she gave him

third_parties.name: Catellon Colin
third_parties.context: Her son fought with his son; son killed her goat with powder from Percin

third_parties.name: Jacques Henry Finance
third_parties.context: Had quarrel and fight with accused and husband; her son killed his naxon with powder

third_parties.name: Vincent Jean Laisné
third_parties.context: His son fought with accused's son; her son tried to kill naxon with powder but it only became ill

economic_context.details: Witness reported debt of 100 francs from bullock deaths. Husband had many disputes and lawsuits with old maire and his son. Dispute over house bidding. Dispute over tax collection. Multiple accusations followed economic transactions (leasing animals, making deals).

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows complex family witchcraft transmission (father to daughter to son). Multiple human deaths attributed to accused through poisoning/bewitching. Prior trial in 1589 where she was released. Extensive confession under torture implicating many accomplices. Notable economic context with debts and property disputes underlying many accusations.
